name: aircraft production, belly-freight aircraft, short haul | aircraft, belly freight, short haul | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20646/documentation

The dataset represents the production of a belly-freight aircraft used for short haul flights (800 - 1500 km). The average short haul aircraft was calculated from global flight data (OAG, 2016), with 40 different aircraft types used for flights of between 800km and 1500 km weighted according to their tonne kms in 2016.;Belly-freight aircraft were defined as any aircraft carrying both passengers and freight. Allocation factors for passengers and belly-freight were calculated according to EN 16’058, using the weight of the passengers and luggage (105 kg / passenger according to EASA 2009) and the weight of the freight on the flight. Depending on the flight, passengers are thus allocated between 33% and 100% of the burdens of the flight. The unweighted average allocation factor for passengers over all flights is 86%.;The material composition of the average short haul aircraft was calculated using data on the operating empty weight (OEW) and the material breakdown (percentage aluminium, titanium, nickel, steel and composite) (both obtained from Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018)). The material breakdown is presented in Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018) as a function of the production year, so the average of the material breakdown for the first and last years of production is applied to calculate the materials for each aircraft. For belly-freight aircraft the breakdown is approximately: 60% aluminium, 25% composite and 12% steel,with the remaining material made up of nickle and titanium. The composite material used for aircraft manufacture is modelled in the dataset as carbon fibre reinforced plastic, using the dataset from Cox, Jemiolo and Mutel (2018).;Production data (energy and water) and emissions (VOCs and wastewater) from Airbus’ European manufacturing facilities (Airbus, 2017) are used to model aircraft production, with the Airbus data extrapolated to the average short haul aircraft using a per seat calculation. I.e. Airbus data on the number and models of airplane deliveries (Airbus, 2016) is used along with the maximum seating capacity of the aircraft models (from Cox, Jemiolo and Mutel (2018) to determine the consumption/emission of materials per aircraft seat, which is then multiplied by the average number of seats in the aircraft of the size-class (determined from the maximum seating capacity of the different aircraft models using data in Cox, Jemiolo and Mutel (2018)). The breakdown of the total energy used in manufacturing into different fuels and electricity is based on data for Airbus internationally (Airbus, 2016).;"References:;Airbus (2016) Annual Report 2016. Airbus;Airbus (2017) Blue5 - Sustainable Aviation Industrial Environmental Roadmap: 2017 Status. Airbus;Cox, B., Jemiolo, W. & Mutel, C. (2018) Life cycle assessment of air transport and the Swiss commercial air transport fleet.  Transport Research Part D. 58. 1-13;EASA (2009) Survey on the standard weights of passengers and baggage: Final Report. European Aviation Safety Agency;EEA (2017) EMEP/EEA air pollutant emission inventory guidebook 2016 - Update July 2017: Category 1.A.3.a Aviation. European Environmental Agency.;ICAO (2015) ICAO Data+. International Civil Aviation Organization;OAG (2016) OAG Analytics. OAG"

Aircraft production, starting with receiving/obtaining the material inputs required for construction. 

The activity ends with the production of one aircraft. The dataset includes the materials (aluminium, titanium, nickel and composite materials), energy (electricity and heat), kerosene (for aircraft testing) and water used in the production. Emissions of VOCs are also included. Emissions from the production of composite materials are included via an input of carbon fibre reinforced plastic. Electronics and interior materials (plastics, textiles etc.) have not been included due to a lack of available data.
category: C:Manufacturing/30:Manufacture of other transport equipment/303:Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery/3030:Manufacture of air and spacecraft and related machinery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production data is for 2016. The global aircraft fleet is also for 2016.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The aircraft modelled is representative of the global aircraft fleet (i.e.plane weight, number of seats etc). Production data are taken from European production sites.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The aircraft modelled is representative of the global aircraft fleet operating in 2016. Current production technology, with the evolving material composition of planes taken into account by taking the material composition as the average of the first and last years of production.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Manufacturing data has been extrapolated from a single European manufacturer to represent all aircraft production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Global flight databases; literature data. Manufacturing data is taken from the environmental reports of a major Euorpean manufacturer. The aircraft parameters are derived from a dataset covering 99.5% of all scheduled flights in 2016.

exchanges.description: Extrapolated value from literature: Total energy use at Airbus" European sites (Airbus Blue5, 2017), with the breakdown into electricity, stationary fuel and mobile fuel using Airbus group data (Airbus AR, 2016). Natural gas makes up 96% of stationary fuel use (Airbus AR, 2016). Scaled to average short-haul plane by applying a per seat calculation using Airbus plane production data (Airbus AR, 2016) and maximum number of seats per aircraft type (Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel, 2018). Weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016).

exchanges.description: Extrapolated value from literature: Airbus European sites environmental data (Airbus Blue5, 2017). "Industrial water discharge" assumed to be discharged to municipal water treatment. 10% of water input is estimated to be evaporated (with percentage of evaporative loss from water consumption and discharge data available in Airbus AR (2016)), and the balance discharged to surface water. Scaled to average short-haul plane by applying a per seat calculation using Airbus plane production data (Airbus AR, 2016) and maximum number of seats per aircraft type (Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel, 2018). Weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016).

exchanges.description: Titanium is estimated to make up 5% of a short-haul belly-freighter aircraft, with an operating empty weight of 50 tonnes (aircraft data from Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018) and weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016)). Because the material breakdown for the different aircraft has changed over time, the percentage applied from the time series data given in Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018) is the average of the first and final years in which the particualr aircraft has been produced.

exchanges.description: Titanium and nickel at end of aircraft life. Assumed to be represented by scrap copper as all three metals are first-row transition metals. Set equal to the titanium and nickel used for production.

exchanges.description: Extrapolated value from literature: Total energy use at Airbus" European sites (Airbus Blue5, 2017), with the breakdown into electricity, stationary fuel and mobile fuel using Airbus group data (Airbus AR, 2016). Scaled to average short-haul plane by applying a per seat calculation using Airbus plane production data (Airbus AR, 2016) and maximum number of seats per aircraft type (Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel, 2018). Weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016).

flow.name: electricity, medium voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

defaultProvider.name: market group for electricity, medium voltage | electricity, medium voltage | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Jet fuel used for testing. Extrapolated value from literature: Total energy use at Airbus" European sites (Airbus Blue5, 2017), with the breakdown into electricity, stationary fuel and mobile fuel using Airbus group data (Airbus AR, 2016). Jet fuel makes up 97% of mobile fuel use (Airbus AR, 2016). Scaled to average short-haul plane by applying a per seat calculation using Airbus plane production data (Airbus AR, 2016) and maximum number of seats per aircraft type (Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel, 2018). Weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016).

Jet fuel makes up 97% of mobile fuel use (Airbus AR, 2016). Scaled to average short-haul plane by applying a per seat calculation using Airbus plane production data (Airbus AR, 2016) and maximum number of seats per aircraft type (Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel, 2018). Weighting and types of planes making up the short-haul distance class from global flight data for 2016 (OAG 2016).
